intro: Phlegmariurus horizontalis, commonly known as the horizontal thyme-moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on decaying wood or soil in temperate regions. The plant has a prostrate growth habit, with closely spaced, leaf-like structures that form a dense mat. Its leaves are usually narrow and arranged horizontally, giving it a distinctive appearance. This species plays an important ecological role in nutrient cycling and habitat provision for microorganisms and small invertebrates.
